import folium
from folium.plugins import FastMarkerCluster

        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.04f5d9fa:
mean = df['price'].mean()
std = df['price'].std()
upper_limit = mean + 3 * std
df = df[df['price'] < upper_limit]
source.eb375d60:
plt.figure(figsize=(6,6))
sns.boxplot(y=df['price'] )#Show below the upper limit
plt.title("Distribution of Price")
plt.show()
source.50f98b1a:
plt.figure(figsize=(6,6))
numbers = df['neighbourhood'].value_counts()
plt.pie(numbers.values, labels=numbers.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
plt.title('Numbers in Each Neigbourhoods')
source.628aa1bb:
plt.figure(figsize=(20, 10))
sns.boxplot(x="neighbourhood", y="price", data=df)
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.show()
source.b71542a4:

numbers = df['room_type'].value_counts()
plt.pie(numbers.values, labels=numbers.index, colors=['cyan', 'green', 'pink'], autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True,startangle=90)
plt.title('Numbers in Each Room Types')

plt.title('Distribution of Room Types in the Map')

plt.show()
source.a50a0309: Average prices is around 484 but the standart deviation of the price is high, which means there are houses which are far expensive than the average and the number of this kind of houses is not low.
source.e23c362d: Mostly the houses are entire home or private room. Shared room numbers are quite low. Let's see the room types in each neighbourhoods
source.43fdee0b: There is lots of outliers in the dataset. Let's see without them.
source.c15823a0: All of the *neighbourhood_group* is the null values. Generally the dataset is the filled with information.
source.e86d1d93: Most expensive neighbourhoods are Catalca Beykoz which is quite normal. These are the favorite places of Istanbul.
source.4e894371: Average price is 484. Most of the houses are available most of year.
